name: A witches Brew
description: There is no power greater then nature. Harness the magics of the elder forces and old gods themselves to shape yourself and your surroundings into a more desirable shape. Necromancy, Demons, spells, and more await you in the depths of these chapters.

quests.name: Rootline Bling
quests.description: You used to call us on your witch phone. But seriously there's more to being a witch then just lighting trees on fire. In fact you're going to need to plant some rather specialized plants.

tasks.longDescription: Both Wolfsbane and Water Artichokes should be easy enough to find if you use a hoe to till soil. Keep in mind that wolfsbane is a little more rare then Water Artichokes. Simply grow one of each and collect what the produce when they are done growing.

Mandrakes like Water Artichokes and Wolfsbane also come from tilling soil, BUT when you pull them up you need to keep a few things in mind. First you should probably harvest it at night... and second even if you do harvest it at night there's still a chance it will wake up when you harvest it screaming.

Sometimes when you are harvesting Mandrakes you really have no choice but to simply make yourself something so you can't hear them scream. Meat the Ear Muffs, they are great for blocking out all sound.

quests.name: The Anointed One
quests.description: You know how in movies you always used to see witches huddled around Cauldruns? Well that's also how you're supposed to do it. But for that you need a special kind of Cauldrun.

tasks.longDescription: The paste is actually fairly simple to make. Simply take the 4 Seeds that you have already and mash them together on a crafting table. Then you have this lovely blue goop to rub all over your iron baby.

Once you have made your Cauldron, remember that you need to fill it with water, and then put that water to boil (With Netherrack on fire underneath it) in order to get the desired effects. This is the basis of most of your witchery recipies.

quests.name: It's a Mutandis!
quests.description: One of the very first items that you should consider making in your cauldron is Mutandis. It's a simple thing that acts like bone meal, but instead of growing things it makes them different.

tasks.longDescription: Mutandis is easy enough to craft. Get that Witches Cauldron to a boil and then throw in an egg, some mandrake root, and Exhale of the Horned one from your witches Oven. Once all three are mixed in the cauldron some lovely mutandis should spit right out.
For our next magic trick we're going to make this tree turn into something else. Alright so once you have the mutandis apply it to some saplings and you should get some interesting results.

Trees and their saplings aren't the only things that can be mutated. Grass, Shrubs, even vines can all find themsleves as something slightly different. Though be warned to collect these you'll probably need some shears.

quests.name: Come 'ere Poppet
quests.description: What fun would it be to be a witch if you couldn't make a vodoo doll of some sort, and that is in a lot of ways exactly what the poppet is.

tasks.longDescription: Crafting a poppet is fairly simple. You need some of that Spanish moss you just made with the mutandis, some string, and something called a bone needle which you can get by combining a bone with some flint.

Poppets come in any number of varietys but it's important to understand that their first use can be to protect you. let's start off simple with this water protection poppet which will break when you would drown.

quests.name: Locking on
quests.description: What good is the poppet if it's not tied to your soul? Well that's where the taglock kit comes in. Using that same bone needle and a bottle you can make one.

tasks.longDescription: The truth is that you can sample your own blood by right clicking yourself, but what if you want a friends blood... you know to protect them? Well using the taglock kit on their bed (where they last slept) should do the trick!

quests.name: When they come Knocking
quests.description: Have you ever had that rude neighbor that comes to your house in the middle of the night and just lets himself in? Ever wanted to stop that behavior?

tasks.longDescription: Rowan wood doors are made from, oddly enough, Rowan wood which is one of the altered sapling types from before. But they are special in that they will only open for one person, the person that is holding the key.

Getting the key should be simple enough. All you  need to do is place the door and if you have an empty space in your inventory you will get a key to go along with it. Don't worry the keys can be made into keyrings if you have multiple doors.

quests.name: Alderan?
quests.description: Why not quite a fictional planet destroyed by the  might of the Empire's greatest weapon, this door does have some nifty properties.

tasks.longDescription: Unlike a normal door which can be opened with redstone, instead the Alder wood door creates a redstone signal when it is opened. You can use this to make any number of traps I'm sure.

quests.name: Altered State of Mind
quests.description: Well how could you be a witch if you didn't perform strange rituals in the woods? Well now it's your turn to start down that path. Why don't you give it a shot

tasks.longDescription: To complete your altar put down the pieces in a 2x3 pattern. When you are done a red tablecloth should appear across the top. The alter requires living things to power it (trees, grass, crops, and more) and so you need diverse foiliage from all around to power it.

quests.name: Bring me their head
quests.description: Around the world, in strange monuments you may find the truth to it, that we are all just dust in the wind and all that is left is an empty skull.

tasks.longDescription: There is a small  chance you will find these just wondering about the world anyway, but if you want to give your Altar a bit more recharge rate, simply slam a skull on it. You may find these on a dispatched skeleton or simply laying around.

Normal Skeletons are cool, but you know what's even cooler? Wither Skeletons. These terrifying creatures can actually be got by dipping a skeleton into witch water which is a fancy form of water that you get from a barrel of water surrounded by mycelium. OR alternatively you can go to the nether .

quests.name: Advanced Burning
quests.description: It's time to head back to the witches oven to see what new things you can cook up if you expose those fancy new saplings you got to flame.

tasks.longDescription: Each of these can be created with some form of rare and mutated sapling that you made with Mutandis. Burning them may take a bit, but you will eventually get your fumes.

Yeah I didn't like Molten Core Attunement either, lucky for you this isn't nearly as difficult. Simply take a Diamond, a Whiff of Magic and a Lava bucket and  you will have yourself a lovely attuned stone whose uses are almost boundless.

quests.name: I'm going to cut you!
quests.description: Sometimes gathering these rare and strange materials off creatures isn't easy, well what if we told you that if you cut them with a certain blade it will get a bit easier.

tasks.longDescription: The Arathana is a special blade which can be placed on your Altar to expand it's range from 16 blocks to 32, but it can also be used when hunting creatures to make gathering their bit easier.

quests.name: Bat Bits
quests.description: You may have noticed that there are strang things dropping from creatures you're not quite used to. Well we're here to explain those strange things.

tasks.longDescription: Dropped from all sorts of bats (tiny and large) the wool of bat is an item that is key in more then a few witchery rituals and so it deserves some amount of respect, though it can be tough to get.

You can get this from man's best friend, or hell hounds. For ethical reasons we /strongly/ suggest that you get it from hell hounds which reside in the nether rather then killing your friendly pooches.

A Creeper heart and a witches hand. it is our hope that these should be simple enough to find in terms of where they come from. A creepers heart finds it's uses in certain rituals, while a witches hand is great in others. Collect both!

quests.name: The Golden Chalice
quests.description: Well I wouldn't let that potter boy drink from this thing or throw his name into it, that's for sure, but there are some other uses to this needlessly fancy cup.

tasks.longDescription: Good thing we had you make those attuned stones earlier hmm? Almost like it was part of some kind of eery plan on our part. But hey get this the Chalice is great for boosting the maximum power of your altar so you should definately put it on there.

You can also put a Torch on your Altar to make it recharge faster, but we know you won't settle for something so plain. Instead we're going to make a Candelabra, which isn't to tough to make resource wise but definately looks fancier (and recharges Twice as fast as) a torch.

quests.name: Distill some information
quests.description: The distillary is another one of those items that allows you take those fancy objects your making and reaelly boil them down for their magical properties!

tasks.longDescription: The distillary must be in range of your altar in order to function. Then you simply fill it up with clay jars and you can distill your very own collection of items.

There's a little to learn here but that's ok. First you can put Wood Ash in a crafting bench to make quick lime. Put that in a distillary with foul fumes to make gypsum. Then for Tears of the goddess simply mix her breath with a bit  of lapis and you've got yourself what you need.
Made from the Gypsum earlier, Ritual chalk will be important for any number of things including as I'm sure you guessed it... rituals

quests.name: The Guide to Rituals
quests.description: We want to give you plenty of time to read this before you really start to step into the next chapters, because this stuff can get quite complex.

tasks.longDescription: This little book can guide you through all that you need to know about setting up the rituals near your altar, powerful binding magic, teleportation magic and more.

quests.name: Pot calls Kettle
quests.description: Sometimes when you're brewing you just want to make something simple enough to drink right? Well that's where the Kettle Comes in handy.

tasks.longDescription: Like the distillary the kettle must be near the altar to function and like the Cualdron must have a good source of water and fire. Once you have all these things going you're on your way to making great brews and eventually infusions.

quests.name: Brewing Challenges
quests.description: Now that you have your Cauldron it's time to learn exactly what you can use that facinating little hunk of metal to make. For that you're going to need a bit of a guide, and that is where this little book comes in handy.

tasks.longDescription: This handy guide has more information then you could possibly imagine crammed inside, and when you are looking for answers to questions that don't quite make sense, this little book may just have the answer.

quests.name: To the EXTREME!
quests.description: So you have made mutandis and you've even distilled things, well now it's time to step up your game because there's a lot more to being a witch then simply throwing a few items in a pot.

tasks.longDescription: Like it's cousin Mutandis, this version finds it's home in a Cauldron. To make it though you need some netherwart and a bit of Mutandis. Mixing them together will get you your results. It has it's own special properties (Grass to Mycelium for instance) but we need it for recipies down the line.
Another ingredient that was produced along with Gypsum, Oil of Vitriol has it's uses in some more.... sadistic rituals. Keep it around (As you should have some already from when you made the Gypsum).

We told you that oil of vitriol would come in handy, and if you've ever been sad before you'll never be sadder then literally burning your diamonds. Well this is useful so wipe away those tears (wait don't you might need them).

quests.name: Dark Powers
quests.description: So Far your dabbles in witches magic has kept mostly peaceful, but it's time we started getting a bit darker don't you think?

tasks.longDescription: You do apparently. By combining a Ghast Tear with some Diamond Vapor in a distillary one of the items you can get is a bit of refined evil. If it gets that from the diamond burned or the Ghast tear we're still not sure.
Mandrake Root, Netherwart, Tear of the Goddes, Refined Evil, and Mutandis Extremis. Mix it all together in a Cauldron and you'll find yourself with a drop of luck. Which has more then a few uses.

To start you're going to need to put the following items in a kettle. Redstone, Drop of Luck, Wool of Bat, Tongue of Dog, Mandrake Root, and Belladonna. From there you'll be able to get your Redstone Soup!

quests.name: Forestfolk
quests.description: So we're fairy sure you've noticed by now that if you cut down enough trees, this nasty angry tree creature might come out and beat you up for it. Welll you're going to want to beat /him/ up! Yeah

tasks.longDescription: Treants generally only show up if you start chopping down the magically infused woods like Alder, Hawthorne, and Rowan. But they are important for the twig they carry which can be useful in more then a few rituals.

quests.name: The Ultimate Poppet
quests.description: There is one final Poppet you should be aware of. one that is critcal to surving some of the most powerful infusions. This final poppet is the only way to become one of the most powerful witches.

tasks.longDescription: Gold Nuggets, a Drop of Luck, and Diamond Vapor. These are what's required to make the poppet that will keep you safe no matter what the threat, taking the blow when you should.

quests.name: A more powerful chalice
quests.description: A normal chalice is nice, but what if we pill it with a potent mixture? That is where the filled chalice comes in handy and we provide you an option to use that redstone soup you just made.

tasks.longDescription: It is quick enough to make. Simply combine a Chalice with the Redstone Soup, but the effect on your altar when you put it back down will be substantial, possibly doubling the amount of power.

quests.name: A witches gear
quests.description: Being a witch is nice and all, but haven't you ever wanted to look like a witch? Well don't worry you're not the only one! Time to start getting to know all the tools of the trade.

tasks.longDescription: It can if you soak it in diamond vapor and a ton of whiffs of magic. By cobining 4 leather with 1 Diamond Vapor and 4 whiffs of magic you can make your very own impregnatated leather.

The ability to spin string into gold is a powerful thing, but for  you it's part of the course. Slam this little puppy down next to your altar. So long as it has power it will be able to spin fantastical things.

By combining a haybale with some whiff of magic in your spinning wheel you can make gold itself. You may even be tempted to melt this down in a furnace for a few gold nuggets, but we're hoping you see that there are some other options.

quests.name: All you need is a wart
quests.description: A witches hat is the start of a great relationship between you and your head, also it may help you brew more things.

tasks.longDescription: Crafting a witches hat is simple. Simply take a bit of that golden string you made along with the impregnated leather and stuff a hint of glowstone dust and before you know it youll be cackling madly too .

quests.name: A slumber to remember
quests.description: Sleepings kind of dull isn't it? You just go to bed and all those horrilbe monsters you were worried about don't appear? Well it's time to fix that right up. Who can live in such a boring world.

tasks.longDescription: Your first step is to use the kettle to make a brew of sleeping, for which sadly you are going to need a brew of Love. Both of these should be in your brewing book so give them a look.

Once you take your advanced strength Nyquil you should find yourself in the spirit world. It's probably going to be a nightmare, so be preapred to defend yourself from the evils of the nightmare and be quick to pick up some Cotton, that is what you are here for!

This will allow you to return to that somber place without the need for drugs. As an added bonus, with a dream catcher you're less likely to find yourself in a nightmare. A good and safe way to get that cotton you were looking for.

quests.name: Teleportation
quests.description: What's cooler then being able to move around from Point A to Point B? Nothing really let's be honest. And for our next trick we're going to show you how to teleport where you need to go!

tasks.longDescription: A waystone is a simple enough thing to construct Using flint and a bone needle, you can craft your very own.

There are just a few more things you need to write out all the rituals you have in mind into the very soil itself. These three chalks will help you. Why don't you try binding a Waystone using the Gold and Normal CHalk, and then teleport to it using the otherwhere chalk at a different ritual site.

quests.name: Poppets Galore
quests.description: Water, Earth, Fire, it almost sounds like the start of a captain planet ritual, but in truth it is so much more then that. A way to keep you alive even in the most dire of circumstances

tasks.longDescription: The fire protection poppet is great for keeping you alive even when you should burn horribliy in a fire. Don't forget to bind yourself to it by putting the Taglock kit with whomever you want to proect's blood along with the Poppet itself into the crafting square.

It won't actually keep your from starving, but if you do starve, rather then dying the poppet will break instead, which may give you just a little more time to seek out and consume that all important supreme pizza.

There is one final item we should discuss, and it may take a bit of exploration into other topics in the land of witchery, but we're confident you'll figure it out You can place a poppet on this shelf and it will work the same as if it were in your inventory protecting you. Be warned though these do function as chunk loaders!

quests.name: Seeing into the future!
quests.description: One more thing that every good witch seems to have these days is the good old fashion crystal ball, and where would you be without that? The answer is no where of course!

tasks.longDescription: Redstone Soup, a Golden Carrot, a Potion of night Vision (Long), Eye of Ender, Mandrake Root, and Spider Eye. These items in a kettle will allow you to make this most basic ingredient to your very own crystal ball, the Happenstance Oil.
Nether QUartz, Blocks of Quartz, and Finally glass and you can make the spehre but... this isn't the final component is it?

Perform the rite of Infusion upon the happenstance oil and the Quartz Sphere and you can use the Crystal ball for all sorts of things. With a bound waystone, see that area. With a Taglock Kit you can see through the eyes of the one who the taglock is from. You can even glimpse the future.

quests.name: I believe I can fly
quests.description: What kind of witch doesn't fly around on a broom? Certianly not you we hope! Well this little method of transportation is just great for getting around, if you can make it.

tasks.longDescription: The first step to making a flying broom, as we're sure you can imagine, is actually making the broom. Made with Twigs and Hawthorn Saplings it doesn't really do much on its own, except for clean away glyphs from chalk very quickly.

Not very easy to make this recipie. Made in the kettle like the redstone soup, this time you're going to need Redstone Soup, A Long Duration Potion of Swiftness, a Diamond, Feather, Wool of bat and a Belladona.

Once you have the items you need it's time to perform the ritual. Look up a a "Rite of Infusion" in your circle magic book. You'll need a Heart Glyph, a Small Circle, and a Medium Circle, throw the broom and flying ointment and then wait for night to come.

quests.name: Fancy Shoes
quests.description: What kind of witch would you be if someone couldn't drop a house on you and get a cool pair of shoes out of it? Well that's the plan so all your future Dorthy's will have something unique to nab from your corpse.
prerequisites: All you need is a wart

tasks.longDescription: Remember that creeper heart earlier, well it's time for you to freeze it. With a Ghast Tear, and an Icy Needle which you can get from a snowbell.

Not walking. The Frozen slippers combine some Impregnated Leather, that Frozen Heart, a bit of Golden Thread, Diamond Vapor, and Odour of purity. These shoes can freeze water and evne turn Lava into obsidian

Tired of being poisoned? Well we have the answer. Meet the seeping shoes. Crafted with redstone Soup, 2 witches hands, some impregnated leather and golden thread and 3 buckets of milk. These shoes will turn those attempts to poison you into bonemeal effects.

quests.name: Necromancy
quests.description: What kind of witch would you be if you couldn't raise the dead? Well we're about to walk you through the very things you need to know to become a much more powerful witch.

tasks.longDescription: An Attuned Stone, Bone, Rotten Flesh, Wood Ash, Iron Sword, and Spectral Dust all placed in a 7x7 Ritual Circle will allow you to perform the Rite of Necromancy, Getting you this all to interesting little stone.
Fantastic for drawing the undead near, this little skulls can be activated by right clicking it with a necromatic stone. it draws all manner of undead near.

Made in the kettle with Wool of Bat, Bone, Rotten Flesh, Oil of Vitriol, Redstone, and Mutandis. These undead won't be hostile towards the player that raised them and what's more they can be controlled by a Necromatic Stone

quests.name: The robe for the job
quests.description: The power to slip between the undead unnoticed. There is a certain appeal to it is there not? Wouldn't you like to go about the world without worry of spooks and haunts trying to murder you?

tasks.longDescription: The Necromancers robes are made with a Necromatic Stone, Impregnated Leather, and Golden Thread. Not only will the undead ignore you, but if you brew up some brews of raising there's a chance you'll get more then one and it stacks with the witches hat.

quests.name: Demons
quests.description: You wish to tap into the deepest, darkest magics of the witch. You wish to begin to make deals with powerful horrible creatures from beyond this realm, beyond even the nether. The demons?

tasks.longDescription: Consult your circle magic and maybe look for something to trap the demon in the circle so he can't harm you while you're at it. Summon the beast and you can either try to take him on or you can try to make a deal. It's up to you.

Alright listen sammy, you can't drink this stuff and become a vessel for lucifer, BUT you can get this by distilling a demon heart with Diamond Vapor. You can use them for a few things... and we'll teach you those.

Not easy to create in any sense these items both have their own little set of powers. The shoes obvious, the whicker bundle... well you've seen those big straw things arorund the world? The ones that look like wickermen? Construct one out of these bloodied Whicker bundles and burn it...see what it summons to the world.

quests.name: The Hobgoblins
quests.description: You may have found these unqiue little creatures throughout your world. They establish wonderful little huts which you can visit and then trade with like they are villagers.

tasks.longDescription: There is a metal that only they seem to know how to mine, that is more precious then anything else. The Koboldite ore. Now... did you know you can leash them and make them work? I know horrible right...
Get enough of their ore and you can even make yourself a litle thing to put on your altar to boost it's recharge rate.

quests.name: Defense of Home
quests.description: Having your own isolated, spooky shack in the woods is nice and all, but wouldn't you love it if you could ward off unwanted guest?

tasks.longDescription: A scarecrow, everyone is familiar with them, and on it's own it doesn't actually have any magical powers, but we're going to infuse it so there is that!
Crafted from Fanciful string which as you learned with the dream catcher is just wispy cotton spun on the spinning wheel, some feathers, and string, you can get your own witch's ladder.
A jack-o-lantern, some Rowan wood, and a bit of Tormented Twin along with some logs and you'll have your very own Treant Effigy!

quests.name: The Undead
quests.description: It's time to play with the undead, and we're not talking about Skeletons or Zombies. no we're talking about things which are far more horrifying in the form of Specters, Spirts, and more.

tasks.longDescription: Before we even begin to summon the undead, we must first have the items needed to deal with them. First is the Brazier which is the actual tool we'll use to summon them, by placing the ingredients into the Brazier and lighting them on fire.
Made with Netherwart, Mutandis Extremis, Wipsy Cotton, and A wheat seed, these seeds are key for summoning some of the ghost and undead out there. (We broke the real recipie, dont' tell anyone)
Once you have your wormwood going simply harvest a few and we'll get about our day hmm?

quests.name: Circular Logic
quests.description: Drawing out all those things can get annoying from time to time, don't you agree? Well we do too and that's why the Circle Talismen was invented.

tasks.longDescription: Crafting the talismen itself is fairly simple. Simply use Gold Nuggets, a Diamond, and Gold Bars, and before you knwo it you'll have your very own talismen, but we want to bind it.
See the rite of binding on the very first page of your cirlce magic book to perform this ritual. These wonderful little tools will make it /much/ easier to setup circles.

quests.name: Rite of Binding
quests.description: The Rite of binding is a powerful ritual that will be used to bind the undead once they have been summoned, but before we get started on that we do need one more thing.

tasks.longDescription: You can get spectral dust from the occasional zombie or Skeleton... if you have a fancy golden dagger and only rarely. But there is another way. Using a Rite of Summoning we can bring a Spectral Familiar to the world... and then murder it.
By mixing that Spectral dust with Bone Meal and Mutandis you can make Graveyard dust, which is the final ingredient which we need for the summoning ritual.

The final component of the ritual involves a great many Ghost (we suggest building some walls to keep them in the cirlce). From there use the Rite of Binding on Page 8 of your circle mage book to get the item you desire. Use your boline to change the behavior of your new fetish.

quests.name: Finding your Familar
quests.description: For this we are going to teach you about making the familiars. Now to simplify things we're taking the resourecs you'd end up needing to simply summon a familiar into the world.

tasks.longDescription: The first item that we are going to need is the Mutating Twig. It has other uses but here it will act as the device to turn certain items into others or Even certain animals into others.

The Critter Snare is a simple enough creation. First put a down some water, then put a spider web over it. Now surround that spider web on 4 sides with Alder Saplings. Finally Let a zombie settle into the spider web and activate it all using the Mutating sprig

The next part of the ritual is to make 4 grasspers. These are made with a chest at the center over water and then 4 pieces of grass around. Got this all down? Great it's time to make your first owl. For the complete ritual Put down water in the center (A block underneath like before) A cobweb on top with a Dog trapped inside. Then 4 critter snares around the Cobweb, and around those the Grasspers with 3 Mutandis Extremis and one with a Charged attuned stone But... this quest we're going to take some things from you to give you a choice.

tasks.description: Put it all in a pot
tasks.longDescription: It's true you can in fact get your own Owls, Toads, and Cats... but how about a choice? Collect EVERYTHING you would need to make an Owl, Toad, or tame a cat and we'll give you a choice.
